news_header: President Trump urges Opec nations to lower oil prices and discusses tariffs, while emphasizing energy independence and investment in AI infrastructure.
news_text: President Donald Trump has called on Saudi Arabia and other Opec nations to reduce oil prices, linking high prices to the ongoing Russia-Ukraine conflict. He expressed surprise that Opec had not acted before the elections and suggested that lowering oil prices could help end the war. Trump mentioned a conversation with Saudi Crown Prince Mohammed bin Salman, who promised significant investment in the US. He also emphasized the need for US companies to manufacture domestically and called for a reduction in interest rates. Trump's speech at the World Economic Forum marked his first address to a global audience since his inauguration.
